Comments_List: Leant about user-centered design with real user experiments; introduction to many different fields of HCI
Human-centered design, ideation, prototyping, tools and techniques

This course is very engaging, and covers almost everything related to HCI. 

Some of the early lectures feel like a repeat of the assigned reading. Sometimes working together with a lazy teammate might be frustrating. The percentage for the Assignment 1b Project Proposal is high, so maybe a heads-up before the assignment might be appreciated.

The strength is that the assignments and lectures are very organized by themselves. 
It could be improved if the assignments could be tied to the lecture in progress; and if there can be few late days/ extensions for the assignment. The assignments usually have a very tight timing. 

Also the quiz in class sometimes doesnt reflect the true status of whether the students do the reading. The single/ multiple choices questions were a bit confusing.
Friendly, accessible professor. I absolutely loved the team I worked with.
This course is the perfect introduction to HCI with lots of hands-on experience designing a HCI interface.
Yes. You can learn a lot by doing the project, which takes efforts and passion.
Yes, it's a great hands-on learning experience.
